intro: Bomarea euryphylla, commonly known as the broad-leaved bomarea, is a herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its striking, often bi-colored flowers that resemble orchids. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as understorey habitats in rainforests. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. The flowering period of Bomarea euryphylla is usually during the warmer months, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
